name: Chicken, Bacon and Mushroom Risotto
author: Slimming World
ingredients:
- 1.5 ltr chicken stock
- 1 onion, finely chopped
- 1/2 tsp dried thyme
- 200g mushrooms, sliced
- 300g dried risotto rice
- 500g skinless, boneless chicken thighs, cut into chunks
- 6 smoked bacon rashers, chopped
- microplaned zest of 1/2 lemon
- 3 tbsp fresh parsley
instructions:
- Bring the stock to the boil in a saucepan over high heat. Cover, reduce to low and keep hot.

- Use a little oil in a deep pan large enough to hold all the risotto, fry the chicken chunks for 6-7 minutes until lightly golden and cooked through. Remove the chicken and set aside for later. Repeat for 2 minutes with the bacon.

- Add the onion and thyme to the pan and cook for 5 minutes until softened but not browned.
- Add the mushrooms and increase to high. Cook for 10 minutes, until the mushrroms are tender and all the mushroom juices have evaporated.
- Reduce the heat to low, stir in the rice and add a ladleful of the stock. Bring to a simmer and stir until the stock has been absorbed, before adding another ladleful. Continue like this for 20-25 minutes, stirring frequently, until the rice is creamy and tender but still has a little bit of texture.
- Stir the cooked chicken and bacon into the risotto with the lemon zest and parsley, and season to taste.
